p: Globally, the aqueous extract from the stem bark of T. mantaly presented the highest antiplasmodial activities in vitro on both resistant and sensitive strains of P. falciparum with IC 50 PfW2 = 0.809 μg/mL ( Table 1) in line with that obtained by Mbouna et al. with IC 50 PfINDO = 0.26 μg/mL and IC 50 Pf3D7 = 1.03 μg/mL [ 13]. The stem bark of T. mantaly was further submitted to oral acute toxicity and efficacy evaluation in malaria rodent model.
